title: The noble gallant, or; An answer to, Long days of absence, &c. He all those jealous doubts of hers removes, and now unto this fair one constant proves, he tells her he is hers, none shall possess him, but her self, such love he doth express; he gives her all content that can be spoken, and chears her heart, which once was almost broken; vvhat e're she asks she has, beauty rules all, it can a lovers heart make rise or fall. To a pleasant new tune: called, the German princesses farewel.
